unnormalised: **Question: What yoga practices have significantly improved your life, and how?**
normalised: **Question: What yoga practices have significantly improved your life, and how?**

unnormalised: Okay, so where do I even begin? Yoga has been a complete game-changer for me. I'm talking from stressed-out Bangalore IT professional to…well, still stressed, but much better equipped to handle it!
normalised: Okay, so where do I even begin? Yoga has been a complete game changer for me. I am talking from stressed out Bangalore I T professional to… well, still stressed, but much better equipped to handle it!

unnormalised: For starters, Surya Namaskar (sun salutations). Doing just 10 rounds in the morning gets my blood flowing and sets a positive tone for the entire day. I learned it properly from a Swami Vivekananda Yoga Anusandhana Samsthana (SVYASA) instructor during a weekend workshop.
normalised: For starters, Surya Namaskar (sun salutations). Doing just ten rounds in the morning gets my blood flowing and sets a positive tone for the entire day. I learned it properly from a Swami Vivekananda Yoga Anusandhana Samsthana (S V Y A S A) instructor during a weekend workshop.

unnormalised: Then there's Pranayama, specifically Anulom Vilom. My grandmother, Shanti aunty, swears by it for calming her nerves, and honestly, it works wonders for me too, especially when I'm stuck in Hosur Road traffic. It's like an instant reset button!
normalised: Then there is Pranayama, specifically Anulom Vilom. My grandmother, Shanti aunty, swears by it for calming her nerves, and honestly, it works wonders for me too, especially when I am stuck in Hosur Road traffic. It is like an instant reset button!

unnormalised: As for Asanas, Trikonasana (triangle pose) and Adho Mukha Svanasana (downward-facing dog) have significantly improved my flexibility and reduced back pain (from sitting hunched over a laptop in my tiny 200 sq ft apartment!). I used to feel stiff as a board, now I can actually touch my toes!
normalised: As for Asanas, Trikonasana (triangle pose) and Adho Mukha Svanasana (downward facing dog) have significantly improved my flexibility and reduced back pain (from sitting hunched over a laptop in my tiny two hundred square feet apartment!). I used to feel stiff as a board, now I can actually touch my toes!

unnormalised: Beyond the physical benefits, yoga has helped me become more mindful and aware of my breath. This has translated to better focus at work and less reactivity in stressful situations. Dr. Sharma at the local ayurvedic clinic even recommended it for my anxiety. So, yeah, yoga is a win-win. Total investment: maybe Rs. 500 for a good mat, and the time – priceless! I even try meditating now for 15 mins a day. Totally recommend giving it a shot!
